com.i2group.apollo.infoservice

Interface IInfoService


  • public interface IInfoService
    A set of methods that variously expose i2 Analyze service information, log error messages, evaluate security access, and test date and time information for validity in particular time zones.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods

      Call evaluateSecurityLevels2 instead.

      Evaluates and returns the SecurityAccessLevel and SecurityGrantLevel on an item with the specified SecurityDefinition, for a user with the specified UserSecurityDimensions.

      Call evaluateSecurityLevelsForCurrentUser2 instead.

        Logs the specified message, at the specified LogLevel.
        Parameters:
        message - A String containing the message to log.
        logLevel - The LogLevel at which to log the message. This parameter may not be null.

      • getUserSecurityDimensions

        UserSecurityDimensions getUserSecurityDimensions()
        Gets the "access" and the "grant" security UserSecurityDimensions for the current user.

        Typically used to answer the question, "What rights do I have?"

        Returns:
        See above.

      • evaluateSecurityLevels

        @Deprecated
SecurityLevels evaluateSecurityLevels(List<SecurityAccessPermission> accessRequirements,
                                                   List<UserSecurityDimension> accessRights,
                                                   List<SecurityGrantPermission> grantRequirements,
                                                   List<UserSecurityDimension> grantRights)
        Deprecated. Call evaluateSecurityLevels2 instead.
        Evaluates and returns the SecurityAccessLevel and SecurityGrantLevel on an item with the specified SecurityAccessPermissions and SecurityGrantPermissions, for a user with the specified UserSecurityDimensions.

        Typically used to answer the question, "What security levels would a user with these rights have on an item with these requirements?" The access level is returned in SecurityLevels.getAccessLevel(), and the grant level is returned in SecurityLevels.getGrantLevel().

        If the user whose security levels are in question is the current user, use evaluateSecurityLevelsForCurrentUser(java.util.List<com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.SecurityAccessPermission>, java.util.List<com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.SecurityGrantPermission>) instead.

        Note: It is not necessary to evaluate both SecurityAccessLevel and SecurityGrantLevel. If you pass null to either pair of parameters, then the corresponding result will also be null.

        Parameters:
        accessRequirements - The SecurityAccessPermissions that dictate what UserSecurityDimensions may provide access permission. There should be at least one SecurityAccessPermission for each "access" security dimension.

        This may be null (to indicate that no SecurityAccessLevel evaluation is required) if accessRights is also null.

        accessRights - The UserSecurityDimensions under consideration, which will typically be associated with a specific user. There should be one (and only one) UserSecurityDimension for each "access" security dimension.

        This may be null if accessRequirements is also null.

        grantRequirements - The SecurityGrantPermissions that dictate what UserSecurityDimensions may provide grant permission. There should be at least one SecurityGrantPermission for each "grant" security dimension.

        This may be null (to indicate that no SecurityGrantLevel evaluation is required) if grantRights is also null.

        grantRights - The UserSecurityDimensions under consideration, which will typically be associated with a specific user. There should be one (and only one) UserSecurityDimension for each "grant" security dimension.

        This may be null if grantRequirements is also null.

        Returns:
        See above.

      • evaluateSecurityLevels2

        SecurityLevels evaluateSecurityLevels2(SecurityDefinition securityRequirements,
                                       List<UserSecurityDimension> accessRights,
                                       List<UserSecurityDimension> grantRights)
                                throws ValidationException
        Evaluates and returns the SecurityAccessLevel and SecurityGrantLevel on an item with the specified SecurityDefinition, for a user with the specified UserSecurityDimensions.

        Typically used to answer the question, "What security levels would a user with these rights have on an item with these requirements?" The access level is returned in SecurityLevels.getAccessLevel(), and the grant level is returned in SecurityLevels.getGrantLevel().

        If the user whose security levels are in question is the current user, use evaluateSecurityLevelsForCurrentUser2(com.i2group.apollo.events.transport.SecurityDefinition) instead.

        Note: If the SecurityDefinition specifies SecurityTags, then it must not also specify security permissions. Depending on the security tag contents, the SecurityAccessLevel, the SecurityGrantLevel, or both are evaluated.

        Conversely, if the SecurityDefinition specifies SecurityAccessPermissions or SecurityGrantPermissions, then it must not also specify security tags. If either permission collection is null, then the returned SecurityAccessLevel or SecurityGrantLevel that corresponds with that collection will also be null.

        Parameters:
        securityRequirements - A SecurityDefinition that indicates the required security permissions against which the specified UserSecurityDimensions will be compared.
        accessRights - The UserSecurityDimensions under consideration, which will typically be associated with a specific user. There should be one (and only one) UserSecurityDimension for each "access" security dimension.

        This may be null if SecurityDefinition.getAccessPermissions() is also null.

        grantRights - The UserSecurityDimensions under consideration, which will typically be associated with a specific user. There should be one (and only one) UserSecurityDimension for each "grant" security dimension.

        This may be null if SecurityDefinition.getGrantPermissions() is also null.

        Returns:
        See above.
        Throws:
        ValidationException - If the SecurityTag identifiers in the specified SecurityDefinition are invalid.
        Since:
        4.0

      • evaluateSecurityLevelsForCurrentUser

        @Deprecated
SecurityLevels evaluateSecurityLevelsForCurrentUser(List<SecurityAccessPermission> accessRequirements,
                                                                 List<SecurityGrantPermission> grantRequirements)
        Deprecated. Call evaluateSecurityLevelsForCurrentUser2 instead.
        Evaluates and returns the SecurityAccessLevel and SecurityGrantLevel on an item with the specified SecurityAccessPermissions and SecurityGrantPermissions, for the current user.

        Typically used to answer the question, "What security levels would I have on an item with these requirements?" The access level is returned in SecurityLevels.getAccessLevel(), and the grant level is returned in SecurityLevels.getGrantLevel().

        Note: It is not necessary to evaluate both SecurityAccessLevel and SecurityGrantLevel. If you pass null to either parameter, then the corresponding result will also be null.

        If the user whose security levels are in question is not the current user, use evaluateSecurityLevels(java.util.List<com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.SecurityAccessPermission>, java.util.List<com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.UserSecurityDimension>, java.util.List<com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.SecurityGrantPermission>, java.util.List<com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.UserSecurityDimension>) instead.

        Parameters:
        accessRequirements - The SecurityAccessPermissions that dictate what UserSecurityDimensions may provide access permission. There should be at least one SecurityAccessPermission for each "access" security dimension.

        This may be null (to indicate that no SecurityAccessLevel evaluation is required).

        grantRequirements - The SecurityGrantPermissions that dictate what UserSecurityDimensions may provide grant permission. There should be at least one SecurityGrantPermission for each "grant" security dimension.

        This may be null (to indicate that no SecurityGrantLevel evaluation is required).

        Returns:
        See above.

      • evaluateSecurityLevelsForCurrentUser2

        SecurityLevels evaluateSecurityLevelsForCurrentUser2(SecurityDefinition securityDefinition)
                                              throws ValidationException
        Evaluates and returns the SecurityAccessLevel and SecurityGrantLevel on an item with the specified SecurityDefinition for the current user.

        Typically used to answer the question, "What security levels would I have on an item with these requirements?" The access level is returned in SecurityLevels.getAccessLevel(), and the grant level is returned in SecurityLevels.getGrantLevel().

        If the user whose security levels are in question is not the current user, use evaluateSecurityLevels(java.util.List<com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.SecurityAccessPermission>, java.util.List<com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.UserSecurityDimension>, java.util.List<com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.SecurityGrantPermission>, java.util.List<com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.UserSecurityDimension>) instead.

        Note: If the SecurityDefinition specifies SecurityTags, then it must not also specify security permissions. Depending on the security tag contents, the SecurityAccessLevel, the SecurityGrantLevel, or both are evaluated.

        Conversely, if the SecurityDefinition specifies SecurityAccessPermissions or SecurityGrantPermissions, then it must not also specify security tags. If either permission collection is null, then the returned SecurityAccessLevel or SecurityGrantLevel that corresponds with that collection will also be null.

        Parameters:
        securityDefinition - A SecurityDefinition that indicates the required security permissions against which the UserSecurityDimensions of the current user will be compared.
        Returns:
        See above.
        Throws:
        ValidationException - If the SecurityTag identifiers in the specified SecurityDefinition are invalid.
        Since:
        4.0

      • getSecuritySchema

        SecuritySchema getSecuritySchema()
        Gets the SecuritySchema that contains information about the SecurityDimensions and SecurityTagGroups available to the i2 Analyze deployment.
        Returns:
        See above.
        Since:
        4.0

      • getSecuritySchemesForCurrentUser

        @Deprecated
SecuritySchemeList getSecuritySchemesForCurrentUser()
        Deprecated. This method always returns an empty SecuritySchemeList. Instead, use the SecuritySchema to determine what SecurityTags are available.
        Gets a SecuritySchemeList containing the SecuritySchemes that exist in the system (that the current user can see).

        Typically used to answer the question, "What security permission settings, that someone else has previously defined, could I assign to items that I create?"

        Returns:
        See above.
        Since:
        2.0

      • getSecurityDimensionsForCurrentUser

        @Deprecated
SecurityDimensions getSecurityDimensionsForCurrentUser()
        Deprecated. Use the SecuritySchema to determine what SecurityDimensions are available.
        Gets a SecurityDimensions containing filtered versions of the SecurityDimensions that exist in the system. Each SecurityDimension only contains values that the current user can see.

        Typically used to answer the question, "What security dimension values could I assign to items that I create?"

        Returns:
        See above.
        Since:
        2.0

      • getChartingSchemeNames

        Collection<String> getChartingSchemeNames()
        Gets Strings containing the names of all available ChartingSchemes.
        Returns:
        See above.
        Since:
        2.0

      • getChartingScheme

        ChartingScheme getChartingScheme(String name)
                          throws InvalidArgumentException
        Gets the ChartingScheme with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - A String containing the name of the ChartingScheme to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        See above.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If there is no ChartingScheme with the specified name.
        Since:
        2.0

      • getTimeZoneInformation

        Collection<TimeZoneInfo> getTimeZoneInformation()
                                         throws InvalidArgumentException
        Gets the TimeZoneInfos for the i2 Analyze deployment, localized for the current user's locale.

        Calls to this method must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named Locale. The value of the Locale attribute must specify the locale of the current user in:

        • a four-character, hyphen- or underscore-separated format that specifies the language and the country, such as en-US or fr_FR, or
        • a two-character format that specifies just the language, such as fr
        Returns:
        See above.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If the SOAP request does not contain the required Locale attribute, or if the value of the Locale attribute is not valid.
        Since:
        3.0

      • validateDateTime

        DateTimeValidationResult validateDateTime(PropertyValue propertyValue)
                                   throws InvalidArgumentException,
                                          ValidationException
        Validates the date and time in the specified PropertyValue by determining whether daylight saving time is in effect, and whether the date and time combination is possible, in the given time zone.

        Note: Since the purpose of this method is to determine whether daylight saving time is in effect, it ignores any indication of daylight saving time in the specified PropertyValue.

        Parameters:
        propertyValue - A PropertyValue containing the date and time information to be validated.
        Returns:
        A DateTimeValidationResult containing the validation result.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If the PropertyValue does not contain well-formed date and time information.
        ValidationException - If a general validation error occurs.
        Since:
        3.0
